text: {{Infobox settlement | name = Sanson | native_name = | native_name_lang = | settlement_type = Town | image_skyline = Sanson Church.jpg | imagesize = | image_alt = Old church framed by trees | image_caption = St Thomas' Anglican Church, built in 1877 | coordinates = | coordinates_footnotes = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = New Zealand | subdivision_type1 = Region | subdivision_name1 = Manawatū-Whanganui | subdivision_type2 = District | subdivision_name2 = Manawatū District | subdivision_type3 = Ward | subdivision_name3 = | seat_type = Electorates | seat = | leader_title = Territorial Authority | leader_name = Manawatū District Council | leader_title1 = Regional council | leader_name1 = Horizons Regional Council | image_map = | named_for = Henry Sanson | population_footnotes = | population_as_of = | population_total = | population_density_km2 = auto | area_footnotes = | area_total_km2 = 0.60 | postal_code_type = Postcode | postal_code = 4817 }} Sanson is a small settlement in the Manawatū District, New Zealand. It is on the junction of State Highways 1 and 3. It is 6 kilometers south of Bulls and 23 kilometers east of Palmerston North. It has a small primary school located in the settlement. == References == Category:Settlements in New Zealand Category:Manawatū District
title: Sanson, New Zealand
